page.title: 06Industries in Malmesbury #1
page.content: The three main industries in Malmesbury are{T.M.C.,Linolite and Lux {Traffic Controls. T.M.C. stands for Telephone Manufacturing Company. It employs 400 people who work in telecommunications, and make things like telephones, terminals and some small business exchanges. During the second world war, Cowbridge House was chosen as a good secluded site for assembling "unspecified" radio equipment. In 1960 T.M.C. was taken over by Pye, but in 1967 it was taken over again by Phillips, an international corporation based in{Holland.}Little manufacturing now takes place in Malmesbury, which is now the main centre for Phillips' telecommunications research. This moved recently from Dulwich near London, and has created a great many jobs in Malmesbury.
